fs.polyglot.undo
Class UndoableLanguageEdit

java.lang.Object
  javax.swing.undo.AbstractUndoableEdit
      fs.polyglot.undo.UndoableLanguageEdit
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable, javax.swing.undo.UndoableEdit
public class UndoableLanguageEdit
extends javax.swing.undo.AbstractUndoableEdit

Implements an UndoableEdit that represents a change in the language list of a polyglot string table. Usually the user should not create an instance of this class directly, but via an UndoableEditFactory instance.

Author:
Simon Hampe
See Also:

Constructor Detail

UndoableLanguageEdit

public UndoableLanguageEdit(Language oldValue,
                            Language newValue,
                            PolyglotTableModel table,
                            PolyglotStringLoader loader,
                            java.lang.String languageID)
Creates an UndoableLanguageEdit instance

Parameters:
oldValue - The old value of the language. null indicates that a new language was added. If old and new value are both null, this edit is considered without effect and it will not post itself automatically. If old value is a language with isOnlyUsed set to true, it will be regarded as if being null, since does not show up in the language list.
newValue - The new value of the language. null indicates that a language was removed. If old and new value are both null, this edit is considered without effect and it will not post itself automatically
table - The table in which the change was performed. If this is null, the edit has no effect.
loader - The string loader for representation names. If null, the default loader is used. If UndoableEdits are created via an UndoableEditFactory, the factory already has obtained the string loader and passes it on.
languageID - The language in which to create the representation string. If null, the global language id is used. If UndoableEdits are created via an UndoableEditFactory the factory uses a common language ID for all created edits.
Throws:
java.lang.NullPointerException - - if table == null

getOldValue

public Language getOldValue()
Returns the old value before the change represented by this edit

public Language getNewValue()

canUndo

public boolean canUndo()
Specified by:
canUndo in interface javax.swing.undo.UndoableEdit
Overrides:
canUndo in class javax.swing.undo.AbstractUndoableEdit
Returns:
true, if and only if one of the following statements is true:
- This edit represents a language change and the new language id exists in the table
- This edit represents a language addition and the new language id still exists
- This edit represents a language removal and the old language id does not exist in the table
- Both old and new value are null

canRedo

public boolean canRedo()
Specified by:
canRedo in interface javax.swing.undo.UndoableEdit
Overrides:
canRedo in class javax.swing.undo.AbstractUndoableEdit
Returns:
true, if and only if one of the following statements is true:
- This edit represents a language change and the old language id exists in the table
- This edit represents a language addition and the new language id does not exist in the table
- This edit represents a language removal and the old language id exists in the table
- Both old and new value are null

performLanguageEdit

public static void performLanguageEdit(PolyglotTableModel table,
                                       Language oldval,
                                       Language newval)
                                throws java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException
Convenience method which changes a language oldval to newval in the language list of the specified table

Parameters:
table - The table in which the change should be effected (If null, then this call has no effect)
oldval - The old value. If null, this is considered an addition of a language
newval - The new value. If null, this is considered a removal of a language (if both are null, this call has no effect)
Throws:
java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - - If this operation cannot be performed
